column4: hiya, I keep getting "FATAL: Error running install command for nvidia" after installing nvidia-glx-new (also tried using Nvidia's own self-installing script"), any idea what I could try?
Did you post your xorg to the pastebin yet by chance
no, but I dont think xorg has anything to do with it, the module wont even load with modprobe nvidia (gives the error i mentioned before)
I always like to look in there... What all have you done or tried so far?

I tried uninstalling nvidia-glx-new, rebooting, installing the nvidia official driver, rebooting, uninstalling, rebooting, installing nvidia-glx-new again... i tried installing a new linux-image and then reinstalling... no help on any of those
If enabling the restricted drivers doesnt work and installing them manually doesnt work then there is a much deeper issue on that box
any hypothesis as to what that might be, or should I just do a clean install?
HAve you installed things from outside official repos, or used scripts like envy or automatix (both scripts are a bad idea)
You didnt add debian repos or anything right
actually i used the "remastered kde4 gutsy" livecd for kicks.. maybe that is part of the issue?
fresh install it is then, thanks
Wish it was a better answer
that's the price you pay for having a convenient distro like ubuntu that tries to do everything for you :P
At least you dont need to call MS to activate it .. :)
